_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP Executive Summary



1.0 Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at Bar-S Foods, Altus Division



Bar-S Food, Altus Division prevents accidental releases through classroom and on the job training of refrigeration personnel and ongoing inspection and maintenance of the refrigeration system. Refrigeration system components are located in areas that are not as likely to become damaged (i.e., tanks and pipe runs are placed away and protected from forklift and truck traffic. The facility maintains an ongoing emergency response program that prepares for safe evacuation and timely response by trained personnel.



2.0 Bar-S Foods, Altus and Anhydrous Ammonia



Bar-S Foods, Altus process and freezes meat products for global distribution. Approximately 66,423 pounds of anhydrous ammonia is contained within the refrigeration system on the site at Bar-S Foods, Altus. A Risk Management Plan has been developed as required and is maintained in order to reduce the possibility of an accidental release of ammonia from the system.



3.0 Accidental Release Prevention Program and Prevention Steps



Bar-S Foods, Altus complies with all rules and regulations that pertain to the safe storage and use of anhydrous ammonia. Specific regulations include: OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) rule; OSHA Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER); OSHA Hazard Communication (HAZCOM); OSHA Employee Emergency Plans and Fire Prevention Plans; EPA Risk Management Plan (RMP) IIAR Guidelines. 



Specific prevention steps that have been implemented to increase the safety of operation of the ammonia refrigeration system include:

- Annual operator refresher training

- Routine preventative maintenance

- Labeling of ammonia system pipes and components

- Safe work practices followed

- Addition of three isolation valves on roof area

- Ammonia detectors in process areas and engine control rooms

- Ammonia detector status displayed in control room

- Update

d computer refrigeration control system

- Security personnel perform hourly checks of refrigeration control conditions

- Security personnel performing hourly rounds outside of plant buildings

- Security cameras inside and outside of main building 



4.0 Five Year Accident History



No releases or accidents, involving anhydrous ammonia, that are reportable in accordance with 40 CFR Par 68 (RMP Rule), have occurred at this facility within the last five (5) years. 



5.0 Bar-S Foods, Altus Emergency Response Program



Bar-S Foods, Altus maintains an ongoing emergency response program in order to efficiently notify and evacuate employees, notify potential critical receptors in the community and state and local emergency response agencies by dialing "911". The program includes initial and annual training for employees who respond to release or potential releases. The program includes written procedures for first aid and emergency medical treatment to treat human exposures; procedures for using emergency response equipment and procedures to review and update the plan and ensure that employees are informed of changes. The facility emergency response plan is coordinated with the local fire department annually as required by the Emergency Planning an Community Right-to-Know Act. 



6.0 Planned Changes to Improve Safety at Bar-S Foods, Altus Plant. 



Future plans to improve anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system safety at Bar-S Foods, Altus include:

- Annual coordination of the emergency response plan with the Fire Department and HAZMAT team.

- Annual Hazardous Material Technician and Incident Commander training. 

- Improved PSM program elements on an ongoing basis.

- Upon hire date, Refrigeration Operators will attend Garden City - Industrial Ammonia Refrigeration Courses 1 & 2.

- Planned hiring of additional refrigeration operators.
